newsitem.title: USA: Harvey sees profit from next "Casper" film.
newsitem.headline: Harvey sees profit from next "Casper" film.

text.p: The Harvey Entertainment Company expects to book $13.2 million in profits from its upcoming direct-to-video "Casper" film, Chairman and Chief Executive Officer Jeffrey Montgomery said.

He said that amount would represent half of the $33 million projected profit for the film, less a small amount of profits it has already recorded. Profits are shared between Harvey and its distribution partners until all rights revert back to Harvey in seven years.
The film, set for release in September, is being made at a cost of $10.5 million, the largest-ever budget for a direct-to-video release.
Another $10.5 million is being spent on marketing, which Montgomery said reflects the strong outlook for the expanding direct-to-video market.
Montgomery said Harvey is expecting to sell seven million units of the movie worldwide, and plans to release a new film based on the Casper the friendly Ghost character each year.
"We want our name to be synonymous with non-violent, quality home movies," Montgomery told the Cruttenden Roth Growth Stock Conference here.
